Member Typedef Documentation

typedef std::map<std::string, long > mc_dbms_typespec::NameMap [private]
 

This maps the type name to a numeric identifier associated with the type. The numeric identifiers start with 1 and increase from there. Values of less-then or equal 0 are invalid IDs.

long mc_dbms_typespec::get_type_id (   )  [inline]
 

Given the string representation of a type, this function return the type's numeric identifier. This is private because for every instance we populate a variable that tracks the identifier.

Parameters:
type The string representation of the type
Returns:
The type's numeric identifier.

dbms_boolean mc_dbms_typespec::name_is (  const char *  name_arg  )  const [inline]
 

This compares the typespec to a name and returns true if the typespec's name matches.

Parameters:
name_arg The name to compare to.
Returns:
This function return true if the objects are equal false if they are not.
